poem:
### Last Orders

Raised glasses and tilted heads,  
a liquid ledger etched in breath.  
Twice as likely—men greet the glass,  
cradle the weight of reckoning.  
Statistics etched like footprints in sand,  
each sip a ripple, each gulp a wave—  
10,473 tides pulled under,  
the ocean whispers their epitaphs.
